intro: Ervum lenticula, commonly known as the broad bean, is an annual legume native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, spherical pods that contain edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, and it is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil through symbiotic bacteria in its root nodules. The broad bean is a valuable crop for both human consumption and as a green manure in agricultural systems.
